awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: NSF/CBMS Regional Conference in the  Mathematical Sciences on Random Number Generation and Quasi-Monte Carlo Methods; Fairbanks, Alaska; Aug. 13-17, 1990
awd_abstract_narration: This project is a CBMS Regional Conference in the                          Mathematical Sciences entitled "Random Number Generation and                    Quasi-Monte Carlo Methods".  This conference will be held at the                Fairbanks campus of the University of Alaska August 13-17, 1990.                     The principal lecturer is Harald Niederreiter of the                       University of Vienna.  His ten lectures will concentrate on (i)                 the theory of quasi-random points and its application to                        computational problems in numerical analysis; (ii) the theory of                uniform pseudo-random numbers and its applications to Monte Carlo               methods; and (iii) the theory of linear complexity for pseudo-                  random sequences of bits and its applications to cryptography.                  There will be an overall emphasis on recent developments from                   these rapidly developing areas.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
